body.p: The Board considered whether another party has any asset that it controls if the reporting entity’s obligation is not legally enforceable but arises from the reporting entity’s customary practices, published policies or specific statements, or is conditional on the entity’s own future actions. The Board concluded that the counterparty does control an asset in such cases. According to paragraph 4.23, if an entity is the party that will obtain economic benefits produced by an economic resource, that entity controls the economic resource.
